How many times in BW did they run out of Ammo?  Well,  your talk on 
story improvement has inspired me (well it hit, but not home, it hit 
an unrelated part of my brain to give me this idea) to create a new 
char I might name LN.  This needs to seem like a real war, and in war 
you don't just have blasting, you have double-crossing, and spying.  
I think I might just create a Predicon who comes to Earth and posses 
as a Maximal to get information and transmite it back to HQ>

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Legendarynemasis@a... wrote:
> The problem does not entirely rely on the players within, it relies 
on the 
> lack of real story in the RPG that isn't known to the entire RPG. 
This whole 
> artifacts thing seems to be some small last attempt to get people 
going 
> again, but how long until battles will begin for the artifacts that 
will 
> undoubtably end and begin and follow through like all the other 
battles? When 
> will bots suddenly realize they have ammo and can't possibly have 
clips for 
> weapons that allow them to fire 120 shots by firing 40 shots in the 
span of 3 
> posts? When will people realize that their charachter can not 
possibly dodge 
> and then counter attack to each person that fired at them in a 
single post 
> when the posts are supposed to last a few seconds each. This isn't 
DBZ, it's 
> Beast Wars and if you haven't noticed noone in the show goes SSJ 
and suddenly 
> dodges everything every five seconds and then returns fire to each 
person. 
> When will players also acknowledge simple facts that some 
charachters cant 
> take the exhuberent amount of damage that others do and sometimes 
the 
> charachter they have is just completely outclasssed, outgunned, and 
if a 
> fight continued against the charachter they were fighting, out of 
service. I 
> have proposed many things to the council and soem  have been 
welcomed more 
> than others yet I have seen none of those even leak into the RPG. 
In order to 
> correct some of the things I have described above the concil needs 
to take 
> more control and enforce certain rules to prevent them from 
happening, of 
> course the players can help too simply by waking up and noticing 
they aren't 
> little kids who are controling a Bantor action figure and having 
him wreck 
> everyone of their toys because they think its cool. We are adults 
and as we 
> all know the only toy Bantor could possibly beat down is Optimus 
Minor. And 
> maybe a spy changer or two since he would get nuked ready fast by 
any BW toy 
> with a gun. Anyway, my ranting is over.
> 
> ~Qs7, LN, Whatever- who now feels like taking a bat to Bantor for 
the hell of 
> it.
